SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Class SQLBatchInsert<T>

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.SQLBatchInsert<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the JavaBeans to save to the database.
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public final class SQLBatchInsert<T> extends Object implements AutoCloseable

SQLBatchInsert specializes in saving potentially very large batches of JavaBeans or records to the database. Contrary to SQLInsert SQLBatchInsert is not a subclass of SQLStatement. It is not underpinned by prepared statements. It still protects against SQL injection, though, as all values except numbers, booleans and SQL expressions are quoted and escaped using the target database's quoting rules.

SQLBatchInsert implements AutoCloseable in order to stay aligned with SQLStatement and its subclasses, and more specifically so you can easily switch between SQLInsert and SQLBatchInsert within your code. However, its close() method currently is a no-op. It is not necessary to use a try-with-resource block with SQLBatchInsert.

See Also:

  • SQLInsert
